chapter.keywords: online king james holy bible, king james bible, bible todo list, words of Jesus, bible index, the authorised version, KJV, KJB, KJAV, AV

items.text: Be ye therefore followers of God, as dear children;
items.plainText: Be ye therefore followers of God, as dear children;

items.text: And walk in love, as Christ also hath loved us, and hath given himself for us an offering and a sacrifice to God for a sweetsmelling savour.
items.plainText: And walk in love, as Christ also hath loved us, and hath given himself for us an offering and a sacrifice to God for a sweetsmelling savour.

items.text: But fornication, and all uncleanness, or covetousness, let it not be once named among you, as becometh saints;
items.plainText: But fornication, and all uncleanness, or covetousness, let it not be once named among you, as becometh saints;

items.text: Neither filthiness, nor foolish talking, nor jesting, which are not convenient: but rather giving of thanks.
items.plainText: Neither filthiness, nor foolish talking, nor jesting, which are not convenient: but rather giving of thanks.

items.text: For this ye know, that no whoremonger, nor unclean person, nor covetous man, who is an idolater, hath any inheritance in the kingdom of Christ and of God.
items.plainText: For this ye know, that no whoremonger, nor unclean person, nor covetous man, who is an idolater, hath any inheritance in the kingdom of Christ and of God.

items.text: Let no man deceive you with vain words: for because of these things cometh the wrath of God upon the children of disobedience.
items.plainText: Let no man deceive you with vain words: for because of these things cometh the wrath of God upon the children of disobedience.

items.text: Be not ye therefore partakers with them.
items.plainText: Be not ye therefore partakers with them.

items.text: For ye were sometimes darkness, but now are ye light in the Lord: walk as children of light:
items.plainText: For ye were sometimes darkness, but now are ye light in the Lord: walk as children of light:

items.text: (For the fruit of the Spirit is in all goodness and righteousness and truth;)
items.plainText: (For the fruit of the Spirit is in all goodness and righteousness and truth;)

items.text: Proving what is acceptable unto the Lord.
items.plainText: Proving what is acceptable unto the Lord.

items.text: And have no fellowship with the unfruitful works of darkness, but rather reprove them.
items.plainText: And have no fellowship with the unfruitful works of darkness, but rather reprove them.

items.text: For it is a shame even to speak of those things which are done of them in secret.
items.plainText: For it is a shame even to speak of those things which are done of them in secret.

items.text: But all things that are reproved are made manifest by the light: for whatsoever doth make manifest is light.
items.plainText: But all things that are reproved are made manifest by the light: for whatsoever doth make manifest is light.

items.text: Wherefore he saith, Awake thou that sleepest, and arise from the dead, and Christ shall give thee light.
items.plainText: Wherefore he saith, Awake thou that sleepest, and arise from the dead, and Christ shall give thee light.

items.text: See then that ye walk circumspectly, not as fools, but as wise,
items.plainText: See then that ye walk circumspectly, not as fools, but as wise,

items.text: Redeeming the time, because the days are evil.
items.plainText: Redeeming the time, because the days are evil.

items.text: Wherefore be ye not unwise, but understanding what the will of the Lord is.
items.plainText: Wherefore be ye not unwise, but understanding what the will of the Lord is.

items.text: And be not drunk with wine, wherein is excess; but be filled with the Spirit;
items.plainText: And be not drunk with wine, wherein is excess; but be filled with the Spirit;

items.text: Speaking to yourselves in psalms and hymns and spiritual songs, singing and making melody in your heart to the Lord;
items.plainText: Speaking to yourselves in psalms and hymns and spiritual songs, singing and making melody in your heart to the Lord;

items.text: Giving thanks always for all things unto God and the Father in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ;
items.plainText: Giving thanks always for all things unto God and the Father in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ;

items.text: Submitting yourselves one to another in the fear of God.
items.plainText: Submitting yourselves one to another in the fear of God.

items.text: Wives, submit yourselves unto your own husbands, as unto the Lord.
items.plainText: Wives, submit yourselves unto your own husbands, as unto the Lord.

items.text: For the husband is the head of the wife, even as Christ is the head of the church: and he is the saviour of the body.
items.plainText: For the husband is the head of the wife, even as Christ is the head of the church: and he is the saviour of the body.

items.text: Therefore as the church is subject unto Christ, so let the wives be to their own husbands in every thing.
items.plainText: Therefore as the church is subject unto Christ, so let the wives be to their own husbands in every thing.

items.text: Husbands, love your wives, even as Christ also loved the church, and gave himself for it;
items.plainText: Husbands, love your wives, even as Christ also loved the church, and gave himself for it;

items.text: That he might sanctify and cleanse it with the washing of water by the word,
items.plainText: That he might sanctify and cleanse it with the washing of water by the word,

items.text: That he might present it to himself a glorious church, not having spot, or wrinkle, or any such thing; but that it should be holy and without blemish.
items.plainText: That he might present it to himself a glorious church, not having spot, or wrinkle, or any such thing; but that it should be holy and without blemish.

items.text: So ought men to love their wives as their own bodies. He that loveth his wife loveth himself.
items.plainText: So ought men to love their wives as their own bodies. He that loveth his wife loveth himself.

items.text: For no man ever yet hated his own flesh; but nourisheth and cherisheth it, even as the Lord the church:
items.plainText: For no man ever yet hated his own flesh; but nourisheth and cherisheth it, even as the Lord the church:

items.text: For we are members of his body, of his flesh, and of his bones.
items.plainText: For we are members of his body, of his flesh, and of his bones.

items.text: For this cause shall a man leave his father and mother, and shall be joined unto his wife, and they two shall be one flesh.
items.plainText: For this cause shall a man leave his father and mother, and shall be joined unto his wife, and they two shall be one flesh.

items.text: This is a great mystery: but I speak concerning Christ and the church.
items.plainText: This is a great mystery: but I speak concerning Christ and the church.

items.text: Nevertheless let every one of you in particular so love his wife even as himself; and the wife see that she reverence her husband.
items.plainText: Nevertheless let every one of you in particular so love his wife even as himself; and the wife see that she reverence her husband.
